title: (x) American Eagle clip art - various {gang}
content:
Anyone know any good sources for the classic American Eagle symbol, maybe a woodcut? Thanks!   
   
Scott
author: scottsherise

comments.content:
I can't find a showing but it's the lower case m in Davys Other Dingbats... and I think you can download it for free at   
   
 [http://www.fontage.com/pages/daod.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224145/http:/www.fontage.com/pages/daod.html)

Maybe, over, at [Briar Press / Cuts & Caps](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224145/http:/www.oneart.com/cgi-bin/briarpress/show.cgi?db=cuts&uid=default&home=1)..   
_( [http://www.oneart.com/cgi-bin/briarpress/show.cgi?db=cuts&uid=default&home=1](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224145/http:/www.oneart.com/cgi-bin/briarpress/show.cgi?db=cuts&uid=default&home=1) )   
   
A very nice resource, by the way, so they say.. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224145im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)_
If you do a search for "eagle" at Briar Press you get the same eagle as Davys.

Oh, sorry.. Hmm..   
Thanks, Patricia, I should have checked your link first, sorry.. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224145im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
_I am too tired, to think, so it seems.._
Both are useful I think - maybe he just wants a clip and not a font.

Scott - you can get some good American Eagle   
clip art in this book.   
   
 [HERE](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224145/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0486255956/qid=1086715469/sr=1-2/ref=sr_1_2/104-8614362-4271944?v=glance&s=books).
thanks you guys...yeah just a clip, not necessarily a font...the book of clip art is good, but of course I need it right now! Anyone know of a good onlline source?
can you hit borders or barnes and noble on your lunch hour. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224145im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
I don't know if it is exactly what you are looking for, but go to the "E" in [Iconian Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224145/http:/www.iconian.com/) and you'll see Eaglemania.

Why don't you download Davys Other Dingbats at the free source and just transform the eagle into a graphic in illustrator?   
   
http://www.fontage.com/pages/daod.html   
   
Or you can download the low res at the Briar Press site.
Briar press has eps formats too
